articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Phil Stewart, Steve Holland
articles.description: Israel faced a missile attack on Sunday as Iran said it reserved all options to defend itself after unprecedented U.S. strikes that President Donald Trump said had obliterated its key nuclear facilities.
articles.title: Israel under missile attack, Iran says all options open after US strikes

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Commercial satellite imagery indicates the U.S. attack on Iran’s Fordow nuclear plant severely damaged - and possibly destroyed - the deeply-buried site and the uranium-enriching centrifuges it housed, but there was no confirmation, experts said on Sunday.
articles.title: Satellite images indicate severe damage to Fordow, but doubts remain

articles.author: Jamie Freed, Steven Scheer
articles.description: Israel briefly reopened its airspace on Sunday and is expanding flight operations on Monday, aiming to help tens of thousands of travellers stranded by widespread cancellations across the Middle East after the U.S. attacked Iran.
articles.title: Israel starts 'rescue' flights as airlines reroute across Middle East

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: Some Democratic and Republican lawmakers on Sunday called on Congress to rein in President Donald Trump's use of military force in Iran and prevent U.S. involvement in a deepening Middle East conflict.
articles.title: US lawmakers call for Congress to review Trump’s Iran actions

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council met on Sunday to discuss U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear sites as Russia, China and Pakistan proposed the 15-member body adopt a resolution calling for an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Middle East.
articles.title: UN Security Council meets on Iran as Russia, China push for a ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "It’s not politically correct to use the term," the U.S. president said.
articles.title: Trump asks why there would not be 'regime change' in Iran

articles.author: John Irish, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: In a bid to defuse the conflict over Iran's nuclear program, foreign ministers from Europe's top three powers hurried to meet their Iranian counterpart on Friday in Geneva.
articles.title: US strikes on Iran leave hopes for nuclear diplomacy in tatters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said the United States' attack on Iran's nuclear facilities has damaged its credibility and it was concerned that the situation "may go out of control", its state broadcaster reported, following a U.N. Security Council meeting on Sunday.
articles.title: China says US attack on Iran has damaged its credibility

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Lili Bayer, Ana Cantero
articles.description: NATOmembers agreed on Sunday to a big increase in their defence spending target to 5% of gross domestic product, as demanded by U.S. President Donald Trump, but Spain said it did not need to comply just days before a summit in The Hague meant to be a show of unity.
articles.title: NATO agrees to higher defence spending goal, Spain says it is opting out

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian military said the activity in the area prevented Russia from sending a significant number of its forces to Donetsk.
articles.title: Ukraine fighting 10,000 Russian troops in Kursk region, Ukrainian commander says
